Description: Typical range for industrial 1064 nm Nd:YAG lasers cleaning stone surfaces like porphyry; starting at 100 W for light contamination to avoid thermal damage given porphyry's low thermal conductivity (~2.5 W/mK); max safe below 500 W to prevent substrate cracking (e.g., IPG Photonics YLR series specs; academic review in J. Cult. Herit. 2018).
Near-IR wavelength optimized for Porphyry mineral absorption characteristics
Beam spot diameter for precise cleaning of Porphyry surface features
Optimal repetition rate for efficient cleaning with thermal management
Nanosecond pulse duration for controlled ablation of surface contaminants
Optimal scanning speed for uniform cleaning coverage
Recommended number of passes for complete contaminant removal
Optimal beam overlap for uniform cleaning without excessive thermal buildup
